intro: Psychotria sloanei, commonly known as the "Sloane's Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It contains alkaloids, including the psychoactive compound dimethyltryptamine (DMT). Due to its chemical composition, it is of interest in both botanical and ethnobotanical studies.
